segments.text: I catch a glimpse of the cookie jar—it’s like a beacon of temptation for the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the boy’s eyes light up is mesmerizing; it’s a look I remember well from my childhood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel this bittersweet joy for them, knowing that being a kid comes with its own worries, too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But their actions send a wave of panic through me; what if something goes wrong?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The thrill of sneaking cookies without permission adds to the tension, like a ticking clock.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s infuriating to see the mother so unaware, drowning in water and dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Maybe it’s just the nature of parenting—you can only keep an eye on so much at once.
segments.speaker: PAR
